Title.evidence: A single-blind, randomised trial was conducted

Trial_Design.evidence: Children were randomly allocated using sealed envelopes

Participants.evidence: children of both genders, aged 1–5 years, undergoing elective surgery

Intervention.evidence: early hydration (EH) within 30 min of arrival to the post-anaesthesia care unit (PACU) or delayed standard hydration (SH) after 2 h

Objective.evidence: The primary objective of this study was to compare the Face, Legs, Activity, Cry, Consolability (FLACC) score

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the FLACC score in PACU after 1 h

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Children were randomly allocated using sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: A single-blind, randomised trial was conducted

Number_Randomised.evidence: Out of the initially randomised 66 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: FLACC score after 1 h in PACU was significantly lower in Group EH [1 (0.25–2)] than in Group SH [2 (1–3)] ( P = 0.028)
